5505
5515std::array<double, 3> PatchKernel::evalElementCentroid(const Element &element) const
5516{
5517 ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
5518 std::size_t nCellVertices = elementVertexIds.size();
5519 BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(vertexCoordinates, std::array<double BITPIT_COMMA 3>, nCellVertices, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_VERTICES);
5520 getVertexCoords(nCellVertices, elementVertexIds.data(), vertexCoordinates);
5521
5522 return element.evalCentroid(vertexCoordinates);
5523}
5524
5532void PatchKernel::evalElementBoundingBox(const Element &element, std::array<double,3> *minPoint, std::array<double,3> *maxPoint) const
5533{
5534 ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
5535 const int nElementVertices = elementVertexIds.size();
5536
5537 *minPoint = getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds[0]);
5538 *maxPoint = *minPoint;
5539 for (int i = 1; i < nElementVertices; ++i) {
5540 const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoord = getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds[i]);
5541 for (int d = 0; d < 3; ++d) {
5542 (*minPoint)[d] = std::min(vertexCoord[d], (*minPoint)[d]);
5543 (*maxPoint)[d] = std::max(vertexCoord[d], (*maxPoint)[d]);
5544 }
5545 }
5546}
5547
5560long PatchKernel::locatePoint(double x, double y, double z) const
5561{
5562 return locatePoint({{x, y, z}});
5563}
5564
5575bool PatchKernel::isSameFace(const Cell &cell_A, int face_A, const Cell &cell_B, int face_B) const
5576{
5577 if (cell_A.getFaceType(face_A) != cell_B.getFaceType(face_B)) {
5578 return false;
5579 }
5580
5581 int nFaceVertices = cell_A.getFaceVertexCount(face_A);
5582
5583 std::vector<long> faceVertexIds_A(nFaceVertices);
5584 std::vector<long> faceVertexIds_B(nFaceVertices);
5585 for (int k = 0; k < nFaceVertices; ++k) {
5586 faceVertexIds_A[k] = cell_A.getFaceVertexId(face_A, k);
5587 faceVertexIds_B[k] = cell_B.getFaceVertexId(face_B, k);
5588 }
5589
5590 std::sort(faceVertexIds_A.begin(), faceVertexIds_A.end());
5591 std::sort(faceVertexIds_B.begin(), faceVertexIds_B.end());
5592
5593 return (faceVertexIds_A == faceVertexIds_B);
5594}
5595
5601PatchKernel::AdjacenciesBuildStrategy PatchKernel::getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() const
5602{
5603 return m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy;
5604}
5605
5611void PatchKernel::setAdjacenciesBuildStrategy(AdjacenciesBuildStrategy status)
5612{
5613 m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy = status;
5614}
5615
5623bool PatchKernel::areAdjacenciesDirty(bool global) const
5624{
5625 if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5626 return false;
5627 }
5628
5629 bool areDirty = false;
5630 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5631 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5632 if (testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5633 areDirty = true;
5634 break;
5635 }
5636 }
5637
5638#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
5639 if (global && isPartitioned()) {
5640 const auto &communicator = getCommunicator();
5641 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &areDirty, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LOR, communicator);
5642 }
5643#else
5644 BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
5645#endif
5646
5647 return areDirty;
5648}
5649
5656void PatchKernel::buildAdjacencies()
5657{
5658 initializeAdjacencies(ADJACENCIES_AUTOMATIC);
5659}
5660
5669void PatchKernel::initializeAdjacencies(AdjacenciesBuildStrategy strategy)
5670{
5671 // Get current build stategy
5672 AdjacenciesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy();
5673
5674 // Early return if we don't need adjacencies
5675 if (strategy == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5676 if (currentStrategy != ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5677 destroyAdjacencies();
5678 }
5679
5680 return;
5681 }
5682
5683 // Update the build strategy
5684 if (currentStrategy != strategy) {
5685 setAdjacenciesBuildStrategy(strategy);
5686 }
5687
5688 // Reset adjacencies
5689 resetAdjacencies();
5690
5691 // Update the adjacencies
5692 updateAdjacencies();
5693}
5694
5701void PatchKernel::updateAdjacencies(bool forcedUpdated)
5702{
5703 // Early return if adjacencies are not built
5704 AdjacenciesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy();
5705 if (currentStrategy == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5706 return;
5707 }
5708
5709 // Check if the adjacencies are dirty
5710 bool adjacenciesDirty = areAdjacenciesDirty();
5711 if (!adjacenciesDirty && !forcedUpdated) {
5712 return;
5713 }
5714
5715 // Update adjacencies
5716 if (adjacenciesDirty) {
5717 // Prune stale adjacencies
5718 pruneStaleAdjacencies();
5719
5720 // Update adjacencies
5721 _updateAdjacencies();
5722
5723 // Adjacencies are now updated
5724 unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5725 } else {
5726 initializeAdjacencies(currentStrategy);
5727 }
5728}
5729
5736void PatchKernel::destroyAdjacencies()
5737{
5738 // Early return if no adjacencies have been built
5739 if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5740 return;
5741 }
5742
5743 // Destroy the adjacencies
5744 _resetAdjacencies(true);
5745
5746 // Clear list of cells with dirty adjacencies
5747 unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5748
5749 // Set adjacencies status
5750 setAdjacenciesBuildStrategy(ADJACENCIES_NONE);
5751}
5752
5759void PatchKernel::resetAdjacencies()
5760{
5761 // Early return if no adjacencies have been built
5762 if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5763 return;
5764 }
5765
5766 // Reset adjacencies
5767 _resetAdjacencies(false);
5768
5769 // All cells have now dirty adjacencies
5770 setCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5771}
5772
5782void PatchKernel::_resetAdjacencies(bool release)
5783{
5784 for (Cell &cell : m_cells) {
5785 cell.resetAdjacencies(!release);
5786 }
5787}
5788
5795void PatchKernel::pruneStaleAdjacencies()
5796{
5797 // Early return if adjacencies are not built
5798 AdjacenciesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy();
5799 if (currentStrategy == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5800 return;
5801 }
5802
5803 // Remove stale adjacencies
5804 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5805 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5806 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5807 continue;
5808 }
5809
5810 long cellId = entry.first;
5811 Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
5812 if (cell.getAdjacencyCount() == 0) {
5813 continue;
5814 }
5815
5816 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
5817 for (int face = nCellFaces - 1; face >= 0; --face) {
5818 long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(face);
5819 int nFaceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount(face);
5820 for (int i = nFaceAdjacencies - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
5821 long adjacency = faceAdjacencies[i];
5822 if (!testCellAlterationFlags(adjacency, FLAG_DELETED)) {
5823 continue;
5824 }
5825
5826 cell.deleteAdjacency(face, i);
5827 }
5828 }
5829 }
5830}
5831
5840void PatchKernel::_updateAdjacencies()
5841{
5842 int dimension = getDimension();
5843
5844 // Check if multiple adjacencies are allowed
5845 //
5846 // On a three-dimensional patch each internal face is shared between two,
5847 // and only two, half-faces. On lower dimension patches one internal face
5848 // may be shared among multiple half-faces (this happens with non-manifold
5849 // patches).
5850 bool multipleMatchesAllowed = (dimension < 3);
5851
5852 // Define matching windings
5853 //
5854 // If faces can be shared only between two half-faces, there is a one-to-one
5855 // correspondence between the half-faces. Give one half-faces, its matching
5856 // can be found looking for an half-faces with the same vertices but with
5857 // reverse vertex winding order.
5858 //
5859 // If faces can be shared among more than two half-faces, it's not anymore
5860 // possible to define a unique winding order for the vertices of the faces.
5861 // There is no more a one-to-one correspondence between pairs of half-face.
5862 // In this case, when looking for half-face correspondence, it is necessary
5863 // to look for half-faces with reverse vertex winding order and also for
5864 // half-faces with the same vertex winding order.
5865 std::vector<CellHalfFace::Winding> matchingWindings;
5866 matchingWindings.push_back(CellHalfFace::WINDING_REVERSE);
5867 if (multipleMatchesAllowed) {
5868 matchingWindings.push_back(CellHalfFace::WINDING_NATURAL);
5869 }
5870
5871 // Count cells with dirty adjacencies
5872 long nDirtyAdjacenciesCells = 0;
5873 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5874 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5875 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5876 continue;
5877 }
5878
5879 ++nDirtyAdjacenciesCells;
5880 }
5881
5882 // Get the vertices of cells with dirty adjacencies
5883 //
5884 // The list is only needed if multiple matches are allowed and there are
5885 // cells whose adjacencies don't need to be updated.
5886 std::unique_ptr<PiercedStorage<bool, long>> dirtyAdjacenciesVertices;
5887 if (multipleMatchesAllowed && (nDirtyAdjacenciesCells != getCellCount())) {
5888 dirtyAdjacenciesVertices = std::unique_ptr<PiercedStorage<bool, long>>(new PiercedStorage<bool, long>(1, &m_vertices));
5889 dirtyAdjacenciesVertices->fill(false);
5890 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5891 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5892 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5893 continue;
5894 }
5895
5896 long cellId = entry.first;
5897 const Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
5898 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell.getVertexIds();
5899 for (long vertexId : cellVertexIds) {
5900 dirtyAdjacenciesVertices->at(vertexId) = true;
5901 }
5902 }
5903 }
5904
5905 // List the cells that needs to be processed
5906 //
5907 // The list should contain the cells whose adjacencies need to be updated
5908 // and their neighbours candidates.
5909 //
5910 // Cells whose adjacencies needs to be updated are cells having the dirty
5911 // adjaceny flag set.
5912 //
5913 // Neighbours candidates are all border cells and, if multiple matches are
5914 // allowed, cells that share vertices with a cell with dirty adjacencies.
5915 std::vector<Cell *> processList;
5916 processList.reserve(nDirtyAdjacenciesCells);
5917
5918 std::size_t nMaxHalfFaces = 0;
5919 for (Cell &cell : m_cells) {
5920 // Get cell information
5921 long cellId = cell.getId();
5922 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
5923
5924 // Add cells with dirty adjacencies
5925 if (testCellAlterationFlags(cellId, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5926 nMaxHalfFaces += nCellFaces;
5927 processList.push_back(&cell);
5928 continue;
5929 }
5930
5931 // Add border cells
5932 bool isBorderCell = false;
5933 for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; face++) {
5934 if (cell.isFaceBorder(face)) {
5935 isBorderCell = true;
5936 continue;
5937 }
5938 }
5939
5940 if (isBorderCell) {
5941 nMaxHalfFaces += nCellFaces;
5942 processList.push_back(&cell);
5943 continue;
5944 }
5945
5946 // Add cell that share vertices with a cell with dirty adjacencies
5947 //
5948 // For performace reasons, the check is a bit rough. All cells that
5949 // share a number of vertices at least equal to the dimension af the
5950 // patch will be added to the process list. This will add also cells
5951 // that are not neighbour candidates, but it's faster to add some false
5952 // positives, rather trying to filter them out.
5953 if (multipleMatchesAllowed) {
5954 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell.getVertexIds();
5955
5956 int nCelldirtyAdjacenciesVertices = 0;
5957 bool futureNeighbourCandidate = false;
5958 for (long vertexId : cellVertexIds) {
5959 if (dirtyAdjacenciesVertices->at(vertexId)) {
5960 ++nCelldirtyAdjacenciesVertices;
5961 if (nCelldirtyAdjacenciesVertices >= dimension) {
5962 futureNeighbourCandidate = true;
5963 break;
5964 }
5965 }
5966 }
5967
5968 if (futureNeighbourCandidate) {
5969 nMaxHalfFaces += nCellFaces;
5970 processList.push_back(&cell);
5971 }
5972 }
5973 }
5974
5975 // Create the adjacencies
5976 std::unordered_set<CellHalfFace, CellHalfFace::Hasher> halfFaces;
5977 halfFaces.reserve(0.5 * nMaxHalfFaces);
5978
5979 std::vector<std::pair<Cell *, int>> matchingAdjacencies;
5980 for (Cell *cell : processList) {
5981 long cellId = cell->getId();
5982 const int nCellFaces = cell->getFaceCount();
5983 bool areCellAdjacenciesDirty = testCellAlterationFlags(cellId, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5984 for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; face++) {
5985 // Generate the half-face
5986 CellHalfFace halfFace(*cell, face);
5987
5988 // Find matching half-face
5989 auto matchingHalfFaceItr = halfFaces.end();
5990 for (CellHalfFace::Winding winding : matchingWindings) {
5991 // Set winding order
5992 halfFace.setWinding(winding);
5993
5994 // Search for matching half-face
5995 matchingHalfFaceItr = halfFaces.find(halfFace);
5996 if (matchingHalfFaceItr != halfFaces.end()) {
5997 break;
5998 }
5999 }
6000
6001 // Early return if no matching half-face has been found
6002 //
6003 // If no matching half-face has been found, we need to add the
6004 // current half-face to the list because it may match the face
6005 // of a cell that will be processed later.
6006 if (matchingHalfFaceItr == halfFaces.end()) {
6007 halfFace.setWinding(CellHalfFace::WINDING_NATURAL);
6008 halfFaces.insert(std::move(halfFace));
6009 continue;
6010 }
6011
6012 // Get matching half-face information
6013 const CellHalfFace &matchingHalfFace = *matchingHalfFaceItr;
6014 Cell &matchingCell = matchingHalfFace.getCell();
6015 long matchingCellId = matchingCell.getId();
6016 long matchingFace = matchingHalfFace.getFace();
6017
6018 // Only process cells with dirty adjacencies
6019 //
6020 // In order to limit the half faces that need to be stored, we are
6021 // processing at the same time cells with dirty adjacencies and
6022 // their neighbour candidates. This means we will also find matches
6023 // between faces of cell whose adjacensies are already up-to-date.
6024 bool areMatchingCellAdjacenciesDirty = testCellAlterationFlags(matchingCellId, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
6025 if (!areCellAdjacenciesDirty && !areMatchingCellAdjacenciesDirty) {
6026 continue;
6027 }
6028
6029 // Identifty matching adjacencies
6030 //
6031 // If multiple matches are allowed, in addition to the entry
6032 // related to the matching half face, we also need to add the
6033 // entries associated to the adjacencies already identified
6034 // for the half face.
6035 matchingAdjacencies.clear();
6036 matchingAdjacencies.emplace_back(std::make_pair<Cell *, int>(&matchingCell, matchingFace));
6037 if (multipleMatchesAllowed) {
6038 const int nMachingFaceNeighs = matchingCell.getAdjacencyCount(matchingFace);
6039 const long *machingFaceNeighs = matchingCell.getAdjacencies(matchingFace);
6040 for (int k = 0; k < nMachingFaceNeighs; ++k) {
6041 long neighId = machingFaceNeighs[k];
6042 if (neighId == cellId) {
6043 continue;
6044 }
6045
6046 Cell &neigh = m_cells.at(neighId);
6047 int neighFace = findAdjoinNeighFace(matchingCell, matchingFace, neigh);
6048 matchingAdjacencies.emplace_back(std::make_pair<Cell *, int>(&neigh, std::move(neighFace)));
6049 }
6050 } else {
6051 // When cell adjacencies are makred dirty this means that some
6052 // adjacencies are dirty not that all adjacencies are dirty.
6053 // The matchin cell may have no adjaceny associated to the
6054 // matching face or a signle adjacency that should match
6055 // the current cell.
6056 assert(matchingCell.getAdjacencyCount(matchingFace) == 0 || (matchingCell.getAdjacencyCount(matchingFace) == 1 && (*(matchingCell.getAdjacencies(matchingFace)) == cellId)));
6057 }
6058
6059 // Create adjacencies
6060 for (const std::pair<Cell *, int> &matchingAdjacency : matchingAdjacencies) {
6061 Cell *adjacentCell = matchingAdjacency.first;
6062 long adjacentCellId = adjacentCell->getId();
6063 int adjacentFace = matchingAdjacency.second;
6064
6065 cell->pushAdjacency(face, adjacentCellId);
6066 adjacentCell->pushAdjacency(adjacentFace, cellId);
6067 }
6068
6069 // Remove the matching half-face from the list
6070 //
6071 // If multiple matches are allowed, we need to keep the half
6072 // face, because that entry may match the face of a cell that
6073 // will be processed later.
6074 if (!multipleMatchesAllowed) {
6075 halfFaces.erase(matchingHalfFaceItr);
6076 }
6077 }
6078 }
6079}
6080
6086PatchKernel::InterfacesBuildStrategy PatchKernel::getInterfacesBuildStrategy() const
6087{
6088 return m_interfacesBuildStrategy;
6089}
6090
6096void PatchKernel::setInterfacesBuildStrategy(InterfacesBuildStrategy status)
6097{
6098 if (status == INTERFACES_AUTOMATIC) {
6099 if (!isInterfaceAutoIndexingEnabled()) {
6100 throw std::runtime_error("Automatic build strategy requires auto-indexing.");
6101 }
6102 }
6103
6104 m_interfacesBuildStrategy = status;
6105}
6106
6114bool PatchKernel::areInterfacesDirty(bool global) const
6115{
6116 if (getInterfacesBuildStrategy() == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6117 return false;
6118 }
6119
6120 bool areDirty = !m_alteredInterfaces.empty();
6121 if (!areDirty) {
6122 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
6123 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6124 if (testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY)) {
6125 areDirty = true;
6126 break;
6127 }
6128 }
6129 }
6130
6131#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
6132 if (global && isPartitioned()) {
6133 const auto &communicator = getCommunicator();
6134 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &areDirty, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LOR, communicator);
6135 }
6136#else
6137 BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
6138#endif
6139
6140 return areDirty;
6141}
6142
6149void PatchKernel::buildInterfaces()
6150{
6151 initializeInterfaces(INTERFACES_AUTOMATIC);
6152}
6153
6165void PatchKernel::initializeInterfaces(InterfacesBuildStrategy strategy)
6166{
6167 // Interfaces need adjacencies
6168 if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
6169 throw std::runtime_error ("Adjacencies are mandatory for building the interfaces.");
6170 }
6171
6172 // Get current build stategy
6173 InterfacesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getInterfacesBuildStrategy();
6174
6175 // Early return if we don't need interfaces
6176 if (strategy == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6177 if (currentStrategy != INTERFACES_NONE) {
6178 destroyInterfaces();
6179 }
6180
6181 return;
6182 }
6183
6184 // Update the build strategy
6185 if (currentStrategy != strategy) {
6186 setInterfacesBuildStrategy(strategy);
6187 }
6188
6189 // Reset interfaces
6190 resetInterfaces();
6191
6192 // Update the interfaces
6193 updateInterfaces();
6194}
6195
6202void PatchKernel::updateInterfaces(bool forcedUpdated)
6203{
6204 // Early return if interfaces are not built
6205 InterfacesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getInterfacesBuildStrategy();
6206 if (currentStrategy == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6207 return;
6208 }
6209
6210 // Check if the interfaces are dirty
6211 bool interfacesDirty = areInterfacesDirty();
6212 if (!interfacesDirty && !forcedUpdated) {
6213 return;
6214 }
6215
6216 // Interfaces need up-to-date adjacencies
6217 assert(getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() != ADJACENCIES_NONE);
6218 updateAdjacencies();
6219
6220 // Update interfaces
6221 if (interfacesDirty) {
6222 // Enable advanced editing
6223 bool originalExpertStatus = isExpert();
6224 setExpert(true);
6225
6226 // Prune stale interfaces
6227 pruneStaleInterfaces();
6228
6229 // Update interfaces
6230 _updateInterfaces();
6231
6232 // Interfaces are now updated
6233 unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY);
6234 m_alteredInterfaces.clear();
6235
6236 // Set original advanced editing status
6237 setExpert(originalExpertStatus);
6238 } else {
6239 initializeInterfaces(currentStrategy);
6240 }
6241}
6242
6249void PatchKernel::destroyInterfaces()
6250{
6251 // Early return if no interfaces have been built
6252 if (getInterfacesBuildStrategy() == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6253 return;
6254 }
6255
6256 // Destroy the interfaces
6257 _resetInterfaces(true);
6258
6259 // Clear list of cells with dirty adjacencies
6260 unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY);
6261
6262 // Clear list of altered interfaces
6263 m_alteredInterfaces.clear();
6264
6265 // Set interface build strategy
6266 setInterfacesBuildStrategy(INTERFACES_NONE);
6267}
6268
6275void PatchKernel::pruneStaleInterfaces()
6276{
6277 // Early return if no interfaces have been built
6278 if (getInterfacesBuildStrategy() == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6279 return;
6280 }
6281
6282 // Remove dangling interfaces from cells
6283 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
6284 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6285 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY)) {
6286 continue;
6287 }
6288
6289 long cellId = entry.first;
6290 Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
6291 if (cell.getInterfaceCount() == 0) {
6292 continue;
6293 }
6294
6295 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
6296 for (int face = nCellFaces - 1; face >= 0; --face) {
6297 long *faceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaces(face);
6298 int nFaceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount(face);
6299 for (int i = nFaceInterfaces - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
6300 long interfaceId = faceInterfaces[i];
6301 if (!testInterfaceAlterationFlags(interfaceId, FLAG_DANGLING)) {
6302 continue;
6303 }
6304
6305 // Delete the interface from the cell
6306 cell.deleteInterface(face, i);
6307 }
6308 }
6309 }
6310
6311 // Delete dangling interfaces
6312 std::vector<long> danglingInterfaces;
6313 danglingInterfaces.reserve(m_alteredInterfaces.size());
6314 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredInterfaces) {
6315 AlterationFlags interfaceAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6316 if (!testAlterationFlags(interfaceAlterationFlags, FLAG_DANGLING)) {
6317 continue;
6318 }
6319
6320 long interfaceId = entry.first;
6321 danglingInterfaces.push_back(interfaceId);
6322 }
6323 deleteInterfaces(danglingInterfaces);
6324}
6325
6332void PatchKernel::_updateInterfaces()
6333{
6334 //
6335 // Update interfaces
6336 //
6337 // Adjacencies and interfaces of a face are paired: the i-th face adjacency
6338 // corresponds to the i-th face interface. Moreover if we loop through the
6339 // adjacencies of a face, the adjacencies that have an interface are always
6340 // listed first. This meas that, to update the interfaces, we can count the
6341 // interfaces already associated to a face and loop only on the adjacencies
6342 // which have an index past the one of the last interface.
6343 //
6344 // On border faces of internal cells we need to build an interface, also
6345 // if there are no adjacencies.
6346 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
6347 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6348 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY)) {
6349 continue;
6350 }
6351
6352 long cellId = entry.first;
6353 Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
6354 const int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
6355 for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; face++) {
6356 int nFaceInterfaces= cell.getInterfaceCount(face);
6357
6358 bool isFaceBorder = cell.isFaceBorder(face);
6359 if (!isFaceBorder) {
6360 // Find the range of adjacencies that need an interface
6361 int updateEnd = cell.getAdjacencyCount(face);
6362 int updateBegin = nFaceInterfaces;
6363 if (updateBegin == updateEnd) {
6364 continue;
6365 }
6366
6367 // Build an interface for every adjacency
6368 const long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(face);
6369 for (int k = updateBegin; k < updateEnd; ++k) {
6370 long neighId = faceAdjacencies[k];
6371 Cell *neigh = &m_cells[neighId];
6372
6373 int neighFace = findAdjoinNeighFace(cell, face, *neigh);
6374
6375 buildCellInterface(&cell, face, neigh, neighFace);
6376 }
6377 } else if (nFaceInterfaces == 0) {
6378 // Internal borderes need an interface
6379 buildCellInterface(&cell, face, nullptr, -1);
6380 }
6381 }
6382 }
6383}
6384
6399PatchKernel::InterfaceIterator PatchKernel::buildCellInterface(Cell *cell_1, int face_1, Cell *cell_2, int face_2, long interfaceId)
6400{
6401 // Validate the input
6402 assert(cell_1);
6403 assert(face_1 >= 0);
6404
6405 if (cell_2) {
6406 assert(face_2 >= 0);
6407 } else {
6408 assert(face_2 < 0);
6409 }
6410
6411 // Get the id of the first cell
6412 long id_1 = cell_1->getId();
6413
6414 // Get the id of the second cell
6415 long id_2 = Cell::NULL_ID;
6416 if (cell_2) {
6417 id_2 = cell_2->getId();
6418 }
6419
6420 // Owner and neighbour of the interface
6421 //
6422 // The interface is owned by the cell that has only one adjacency, i.e.,
6423 // by the cell that owns the smallest of the two faces. If the faces
6424 // of both cells have the same size, the interface is owned by the cell
6425 // with the "lower fuzzy positioning". It is not necessary to have a
6426 // precise comparison, it's only necessary to define a repeatable order
6427 // between the two cells. It is therefore possible to use the "fuzzy"
6428 // cell comparison.
6429 bool cellOwnsInterface = true;
6430 if (cell_2) {
6431 if (cell_1->getAdjacencyCount(face_1) > 1) {
6432 cellOwnsInterface = false;
6433 } else if (cell_2->getAdjacencyCount(face_2) == 1) {
6434 assert(cell_1->getAdjacencyCount(face_1) == 1);
6435 cellOwnsInterface = CellFuzzyPositionLess(*this)(id_1, id_2);
6436 }
6437 }
6438
6439 Cell *intrOwner;
6440 Cell *intrNeigh;
6441 long intrOwnerId;
6442 long intrNeighId;
6443 int intrOwnerFace;
6444 int intrNeighFace;
6445 if (cellOwnsInterface) {
6446 intrOwnerId = id_1;
6447 intrOwner = cell_1;
6448 intrOwnerFace = face_1;
6449
6450 if (cell_2) {
6451 intrNeighId = id_2;
6452 intrNeigh = cell_2;
6453 intrNeighFace = face_2;
6454 } else {
6455 intrNeighId = Cell::NULL_ID;
6456 intrNeigh = nullptr;
6457 intrNeighFace = -1;
6458 }
6459 } else {
6460 intrOwnerId = id_2;
6461 intrOwner = cell_2;
6462 intrOwnerFace = face_2;
6463
6464 intrNeighId = id_1;
6465 intrNeigh = cell_1;
6466 intrNeighFace = face_1;
6467 }
6468
6469 // Connectivity of the interface
6470 ConstProxyVector<long> faceConnect = intrOwner->getFaceConnect(intrOwnerFace);
6471
6472 int nInterfaceVertices = faceConnect.size();
6473 std::unique_ptr<long[]> interfaceConnect = std::unique_ptr<long[]>(new long[nInterfaceVertices]);
6474 for (int k = 0; k < nInterfaceVertices; ++k) {
6475 interfaceConnect[k] = faceConnect[k];
6476 }
6477
6478 // Create the interface
6479 Interface *interface;
6480 InterfaceIterator interfaceIterator;
6481
6482 ElementType interfaceType = intrOwner->getFaceType(intrOwnerFace);
6483 if (interfaceId < 0) {
6484 interfaceIterator = addInterface(interfaceType, std::move(interfaceConnect), interfaceId);
6485 interface = &(*interfaceIterator);
6486 interfaceId = interface->getId();
6487 } else {
6488 interfaceIterator = restoreInterface(interfaceType, std::move(interfaceConnect), interfaceId);
6489 interface = &(*interfaceIterator);
6490 }
6491
6492 // Set owner and neighbour
6493 interface->setOwner(intrOwnerId, intrOwnerFace);
6494 if (intrNeighId >= 0) {
6495 interface->setNeigh(intrNeighId, intrNeighFace);
6496 }
6497
6498 // Update owner and neighbour cell data
6499 //
6500 // Adjacencies and interfaces are paired: the i-th adjacency correspondes
6501 // to the i-th interface. Moreover if we loop through the adjacencies of
6502 // a face, the adjacencies that have an interface are always listed first.
6503 // When the interfaces are fully built, each adjacency is associated to an
6504 // interface, however this will not be true during the generation of the
6505 // interfaces. If the adjacencies already associated to an interface are
6506 // listed first, it will be easy to detect which interfaces are still to
6507 // be built: the missing interfaces are associated to the adjacencies which
6508 // have an index past the last interface.
6509 //
6510 // The above only matters if the neighbour cell exists, if there is no
6511 // neighbour there will be only one interface on that face, so there are
6512 // no ordering issues.
6513 intrOwner->pushInterface(intrOwnerFace, interfaceId);
6514 if (intrNeigh) {
6515 intrNeigh->pushInterface(intrNeighFace, interfaceId);
6516
6517 // Fix adjacency order on the owner cell
6518 int ownerInterfaceIndex = intrOwner->getInterfaceCount(intrOwnerFace) - 1;
6519 long ownerPairedAdjacency = intrOwner->getAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, ownerInterfaceIndex);
6520 if (ownerPairedAdjacency != intrNeighId) {
6521 int ownerPairedAdjacencyIndex = intrOwner->findAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, intrNeighId);
6522 assert(ownerPairedAdjacencyIndex >= 0);
6523 intrOwner->setAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, ownerInterfaceIndex, intrNeighId);
6524 intrOwner->setAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, ownerPairedAdjacencyIndex, ownerPairedAdjacency);
6525 }
6526
6527 // Fix adjacency order on the neighbour cell
6528 int neighInterfaceIndex = intrNeigh->getInterfaceCount(intrNeighFace) - 1;
6529 long neighPairedAdjacency = intrNeigh->getAdjacency(intrNeighFace, neighInterfaceIndex);
6530 if (neighPairedAdjacency != intrOwnerId) {
6531 int neighPairedAdjacencyIndex = intrNeigh->findAdjacency(intrNeighFace, intrOwnerId);
6532 assert(neighPairedAdjacencyIndex >= 0);
6533 intrNeigh->setAdjacency(intrNeighFace, neighInterfaceIndex, intrOwnerId);
6534 intrNeigh->setAdjacency(intrNeighFace, neighPairedAdjacencyIndex, neighPairedAdjacency);
6535 }
6536 }
6537
6538 return interfaceIterator;
6539}
6540
6550int PatchKernel::findAdjoinNeighFace(const Cell &cell, int cellFace, const Cell &neigh) const
6551{
6552 // Evaluate list of candidate faces
6553 //
6554 // The cells may be neighbours through multiple faces. Identify which face
6555 // matches the target one is quite expensive. Moreover, if the cells are
6556 // neighbours through a single face (which is the common case), the check
6557 // is not needed at all. Therefore, first we identify all the faces through
6558 // which the two cells are neighbours and then, if and only if there are
6559 // multiple candidates, we identify the face that matches the target one.
6560 long cellId = cell.getId();
6561 const int nNeighFaces = neigh.getFaceCount();
6562
6563 int nCandidates = 0;
6564 BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(candidates, std::array<double BITPIT_COMMA 3>, nNeighFaces, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_FACES);
6565 for (int neighFace = 0; neighFace < nNeighFaces; neighFace++) {
6566 int nFaceAdjacencies = neigh.getAdjacencyCount(neighFace);
6567 const long *faceAdjacencies = neigh.getAdjacencies(neighFace);
6568 for (int k = 0; k < nFaceAdjacencies; ++k) {
6569 long geussId = faceAdjacencies[k];
6570 if (geussId == cellId) {
6571 (*candidates)[nCandidates] = neighFace;
6572 ++nCandidates;
6573 break;
6574 }
6575 }
6576 }
6577
6578 // Select the face of the neighbour which adjoin the given face
6579 if (nCandidates == 1) {
6580 return (*candidates)[0];
6581 } else {
6582 for (int i = 0; i < nCandidates; ++i) {
6583 int candidateFace = (*candidates)[i];
6584 if (isSameFace(cell, cellFace, neigh, candidateFace)) {
6585 return candidateFace;
6586 }
6587 }
6588 }
6589
6590 return -1;
6591}

6759bool PatchKernel::testElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, const AlterationFlagsStorage &flagsStorage) const
6760{
6761 auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage.find(id);
6762 if (storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage.end()) {

6764 } else {
6765 return testAlterationFlags(FLAG_NONE, flags);
6766 }

6777{

6789{

6792 return storedFlagsItr->second;
6793 } else {
6794 return FLAG_NONE;

6805void PatchKernel::resetElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
6806{
6807 if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
6808 flagsStorage->erase(id);
6809 } else {
6810 (*flagsStorage)[id] = flags;
6811 }
6812}
6813
6821void PatchKernel::setElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
6822{
6823 if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
6824 return;
6825 }
6826
6827 auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->find(id);
6828 if (storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage->end()) {
6829 storedFlagsItr->second |= flags;
6830 } else {
6831 flagsStorage->insert({id, flags});
6832 }
6833}
6834
6841void PatchKernel::unsetElementAlterationFlags(AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
6842{
6843 if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
6844 return;
6845 }
6846
6847 for (auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->begin(); storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage->end();) {
6848 storedFlagsItr->second &= ~flags;
6849 if (storedFlagsItr->second == FLAG_NONE) {
6850 storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->erase(storedFlagsItr);
6851 } else {
6852 ++storedFlagsItr;
6853 }
6854 }
6855}
6856
6864void PatchKernel::unsetElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
6865{
6866 if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
6867 return;
6868 }
6869
6870 auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->find(id);
6871 if (storedFlagsItr == flagsStorage->end()) {
6872 return;
6873 }
6874
6875 storedFlagsItr->second &= ~flags;
6876 if (storedFlagsItr->second == FLAG_NONE) {
6877 flagsStorage->erase(storedFlagsItr);
6878 }
6879}

6886void PatchKernel::clearBoundingBox()
6887{
6888 for (int k = 0; k < 3; ++k) {
6889 m_boxMinPoint[k] = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
6890 m_boxMinCounter[k] = 0;
6891
6892 m_boxMaxPoint[k] = - std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
6893 m_boxMaxCounter[k] = 0;
6894 }
6895
6896 setBoundingBoxDirty(getCellCount() > 0);
6897}
6898
6907void PatchKernel::setBoundingBox(const std::array<double, 3> &minPoint, const std::array<double, 3> &maxPoint)
6908{
6909 m_boxMinPoint = minPoint;
6910 m_boxMaxPoint = maxPoint;
6911
6912 setBoundingBoxDirty(false);
6913}
6914
6921void PatchKernel::getBoundingBox(std::array<double, 3> &minPoint, std::array<double, 3> &maxPoint) const
6922{
6923 getBoundingBox(false, minPoint, maxPoint);
6924}
6925
6934void PatchKernel::getBoundingBox(bool global, std::array<double, 3> &minPoint, std::array<double, 3> &maxPoint) const
6935{
6936 minPoint = m_boxMinPoint;
6937 maxPoint = m_boxMaxPoint;
6938
6939#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
6940 if (global && isPartitioned()) {
6941 MPI_Comm communicator = getCommunicator();
6942 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, minPoint.data(), 3, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_MIN, communicator);
6943 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, maxPoint.data(), 3, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_MAX, communicator);
6944 }
6945#else
6946 BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
6947#endif
6948}

6955bool PatchKernel::isBoundingBoxFrozen() const
6956{
6957 return m_boxFrozen;
6958}

6970void PatchKernel::setBoundingBoxFrozen(bool frozen)
6971{
6972 m_boxFrozen = frozen;
6973}
6974
6982bool PatchKernel::isBoundingBoxDirty(bool global) const
6983{
6984 bool isDirty = m_boxDirty;
6985#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
6986 if (global && isPartitioned()) {
6987 const auto &communicator = getCommunicator();
6988 MPI_Allreduce(const_cast<bool *>(&m_boxDirty), &isDirty, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LOR, communicator);
6989 }
6990#else
6991 BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
6992#endif
6993
6994 return isDirty;
6995}
6996
7002void PatchKernel::setBoundingBoxDirty(bool dirty)
7003{
7004 m_boxDirty = dirty;
7005}
7006
7013void PatchKernel::updateBoundingBox(bool forcedUpdated)
7014{
7015 if (isBoundingBoxFrozen()) {
7016 return;
7017 }
7018
7019 // Check if the bounding box is dirty
7020 if (!isBoundingBoxDirty() && !forcedUpdated) {
7021 return;
7022 }
7023
7024 // Initialize bounding box
7025 clearBoundingBox();
7026
7027 // Unset the dirty flag in order to be able to update the bounding box
7028 setBoundingBoxDirty(false);
7029
7030 // Compute bounding box
7031 for (const auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
7032 addPointToBoundingBox(vertex.getCoords());
7033 }
7034}
7035
7044void PatchKernel::addPointToBoundingBox(const std::array<double, 3> &point)
7045{
7046 if (isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
7047 return;
7048 }
7049
7050 for (size_t k = 0; k < point.size(); ++k) {
7051 double value = point[k];
7052
7053 // Update maximum value
7054 if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMaxPoint[k], getTol())) {
7055 ++m_boxMaxCounter[k];
7056 } else if (value > m_boxMaxPoint[k]) {
7057 m_boxMaxPoint[k] = value;
7058 m_boxMaxCounter[k] = 1;
7059 }
7060
7061 // Update minimum value
7062 if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMinPoint[k], getTol())) {
7063 ++m_boxMinCounter[k];
7064 } else if (value < m_boxMinPoint[k]) {
7065 m_boxMinPoint[k] = value;
7066 m_boxMinCounter[k] = 1;
7067 }
7068 }
7069}
7070
7079void PatchKernel::removePointFromBoundingBox(const std::array<double, 3> &point)
7080{
7081 if (isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
7082 return;
7083 }
7084
7085 double tolerance = getTol();
7086 for (size_t k = 0; k < point.size(); ++k) {
7087 double value = point[k];
7088
7089 // Check if maximum value is still valid
7090 if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMaxPoint[k], tolerance)) {
7091 --m_boxMaxCounter[k];
7092 if (m_boxMaxCounter[k] == 0) {
7093 setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
7094 return;
7095 }
7096 } else if (value > m_boxMaxPoint[k]) {
7097 assert(false && "Bounding box is in inconsistent state.");
7098 setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
7099 return;
7100 }
7101
7102 // Update minimum value
7103 if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMinPoint[k], tolerance)) {
7104 --m_boxMinCounter[k];
7105 if (m_boxMinCounter[k] == 0) {
7106 setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
7107 return;
7108 }
7109 } else if (value < m_boxMinPoint[k]) {
7110 assert(false && "Bounding box is in inconsistent state.");
7111 setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
7112 return;
7113 }
7114 }
7115}

7123ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> PatchKernel::getElementVertexCoordinates(const Element &element) const
7124{
7125 // Get the vertices ids
7126 ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
7127 const int nElementVertices = elementVertexIds.size();
7128
7129 // Build the proxy vector with the coordinates
7130 ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> vertexCoordinates(ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>>::INTERNAL_STORAGE, nElementVertices);
7131 ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>>::storage_pointer storage = vertexCoordinates.storedData();
7132 getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds.size(), elementVertexIds.data(), storage);
7133
7134 return vertexCoordinates;
7135}

7162
7169std::unordered_map<long, std::vector<long>> PatchKernel::binGroupVertices(int nBins)
7170{
7171 return PatchKernel::binGroupVertices(m_vertices, nBins);
7172}
7173
7181std::unordered_map<long, std::vector<long>> PatchKernel::binGroupVertices(const PiercedVector<Vertex> &vertices, int nBins)
7182{
7183 // Update bounding box
7184 updateBoundingBox();
7185
7186 // Bin's spacing
7187 double dx = std::max(1.0e-12, m_boxMaxPoint[0] - m_boxMinPoint[0]) / ((double) nBins);
7188 double dy = std::max(1.0e-12, m_boxMaxPoint[1] - m_boxMinPoint[1]) / ((double) nBins);
7189 double dz = std::max(1.0e-12, m_boxMaxPoint[2] - m_boxMinPoint[2]) / ((double) nBins);
7190
7191 // Identify bins of vertices
7192 std::unordered_map<long, std::vector<long>> bins;
7193 for (const Vertex &vertex : vertices) {
7194 const std::array<double, 3> &coordinates = vertex.getCoords();
7195
7196 int i = std::min(nBins - 1L, (long) ((coordinates[0] - m_boxMinPoint[0]) / dx));
7197 int j = std::min(nBins - 1L, (long) ((coordinates[1] - m_boxMinPoint[1]) / dy));
7198 int k = std::min(nBins - 1L, (long) ((coordinates[2] - m_boxMinPoint[2]) / dz));
7199
7200 long binId = nBins * nBins * k + nBins * j + i;
7201 bins[binId].emplace_back(vertex.getId());
7202 }
7203
7204 return bins;
7205}
7206
7212void PatchKernel::translate(const std::array<double, 3> &translation)
7213{
7214 // Translate the patch
7215 for (auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
7216 vertex.translate(translation);
7217 }
7218
7219 // Update the bounding box
7220 if (!isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
7221 m_boxMinPoint += translation;
7222 m_boxMaxPoint += translation;
7223 }
7224}
7225
7233void PatchKernel::translate(double sx, double sy, double sz)
7234{
7235 translate({{sx, sy, sz}});
7236}
7237
7245void PatchKernel::scale(const std::array<double, 3> &scaling)
7246{
7247 scale(scaling, m_boxMinPoint);
7248}
7249
7256void PatchKernel::scale(const std::array<double, 3> &scaling, const std::array<double, 3> &center)
7257{
7258 // Scale the patch
7259 for (auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
7260 vertex.scale(scaling, center);
7261 }
7262
7263 // Update the bounding box
7264 if (!isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
7265 for (int k = 0; k < 3; ++k) {
7266 m_boxMinPoint[k] = center[k] + scaling[k] * (m_boxMinPoint[k] - center[k]);
7267 m_boxMaxPoint[k] = center[k] + scaling[k] * (m_boxMaxPoint[k] - center[k]);
7268 }
7269 }
7270}
7271
7279void PatchKernel::scale(double scaling)
7280{
7281 scale({{scaling, scaling, scaling}}, m_boxMinPoint);
7282}
7283
7290void PatchKernel::scale(double scaling, const std::array<double, 3> &center)
7291{
7292 scale({{scaling, scaling, scaling}}, center);
7293}
7294
7302void PatchKernel::scale(double sx, double sy, double sz)
7303{
7304 scale({{sx, sy, sz}}, m_boxMinPoint);
7305}
7306
7317void PatchKernel::scale(double sx, double sy, double sz, const std::array<double, 3> &center)
7318{
7319 scale({{sx, sy, sz}}, center);
7320}

7391}
7392
7401void PatchKernel::extractEnvelope(PatchKernel &envelope) const
7402{
7403
7404 // ====================================================================== //
7405 // RESIZE DATA STRUCTURES //
7406 // ====================================================================== //
7407 envelope.reserveVertices(envelope.getVertexCount() + countFreeVertices());
7408 envelope.reserveCells(envelope.getCellCount() + countFreeFaces());
7409
7410 // ====================================================================== //
7411 // LOOP OVER CELLS //
7412 // ====================================================================== //
7413 std::unordered_map<long, long> vertexMap;
7414 for (const Cell &cell : m_cells) {
7415 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
7416 for (int i = 0; i < nCellFaces; ++i) {
7417 if (!cell.isFaceBorder(i)) {
7418 continue;
7419 }
7420
7421 // Add face vertices to the envelope and get face
7422 // connectivity in the envelope
7423 ConstProxyVector<long> faceConnect = cell.getFaceConnect(i);
7424 int nFaceVertices = faceConnect.size();
7425
7426 std::unique_ptr<long[]> faceEnvelopeConnect = std::unique_ptr<long[]>(new long[nFaceVertices]);
7427 for (int j = 0; j < nFaceVertices; ++j) {
7428 long vertexId = faceConnect[j];
7429
7430 // If the vertex is not yet in the envelope
7431 // add it.
7432 if (vertexMap.count(vertexId) == 0) {
7433 const Vertex &vertex = getVertex(vertexId);
7434 VertexIterator envelopeVertex = envelope.addVertex(vertex);
7435 vertexMap[vertexId] = envelopeVertex->getId();
7436 }
7437
7438 // Update face ace connectivity in the envelope
7439 faceEnvelopeConnect[j] = vertexMap.at(vertexId);
7440 }
7441
7442 // Add face to envelope
7443 ElementType faceType = cell.getFaceType(i);
7444 envelope.addCell(faceType, std::move(faceEnvelopeConnect));
7445 }
7446 }
7447}

7459
7460 // ====================================================================== //

7581
7588void PatchKernel::replaceVTKStreamer(const VTKBaseStreamer *original, VTKBaseStreamer *updated)
7589{
7590 // Update the VTK streamer
7591 //
7592 // The pointer to VTK streamers are copied, if there are pointer to the
7593 // original object they have to be replace with a pointer to this object.
7594 // Geometry fields
7595 std::vector<std::string> streamedGeomFields;
7596 streamedGeomFields.reserve(m_vtk.getGeomDataCount());
7597 for (auto itr = m_vtk.getGeomDataBegin(); itr != m_vtk.getGeomDataEnd(); ++itr) {
7598 const VTKField &field = *itr;
7599 if (&field.getStreamer() != original) {
7600 continue;
7601 }
7602
7603 streamedGeomFields.push_back(field.getName());
7604 }
7605
7606 for (const std::string &name : streamedGeomFields) {
7607 const VTKField &field = *(m_vtk.findGeomData(name));
7608 VTKField updatedField(field);
7609 updatedField.setStreamer(*updated);
7610
7611 m_vtk.setGeomData(std::move(updatedField));
7612 }
7613
7614 std::vector<std::string> streamedDataFields;
7615 streamedDataFields.reserve(m_vtk.getDataCount());
7616 for (auto itr = m_vtk.getDataBegin(); itr != m_vtk.getDataEnd(); ++itr) {
7617 const VTKField &field = *itr;
7618 if (&field.getStreamer() != original) {
7619 continue;
7620 }
7621
7622 streamedDataFields.push_back(field.getName());
7623 }
7624
7625 for (const std::string &name : streamedDataFields) {
7626 const VTKField &field = *(m_vtk.findData(name));
7627 VTKField updatedField(field);
7628 updatedField.setStreamer(*updated);
7629
7630 m_vtk.removeData(field.getName());
7631 m_vtk.addData(std::move(updatedField));
7632 }
7633}
7634
7645void PatchKernel::flushData(std::fstream &stream, const std::string &name, VTKFormat format)
7646{
7647 assert(format == VTKFormat::APPENDED);
7648 BITPIT_UNUSED(format);
7649
7650 if (name == "Points") {
7651 VertexConstIterator endItr = vertexConstEnd();
7652 for (VertexConstIterator itr = vertexConstBegin(); itr != endItr; ++itr) {
7653 std::size_t vertexRawId = itr.getRawIndex();
7654 long vertexVTKId = m_vtkVertexMap.rawAt(vertexRawId);
7655 if (vertexVTKId != Vertex::NULL_ID) {
7656 const Vertex &vertex = m_vertices.rawAt(vertexRawId);
7657 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, vertex.getCoords());
7658 }
7659 }
7660 } else if (name == "offsets") {
7661 long offset = 0;
7662 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7663 offset += cell.getVertexCount();
7664 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, offset);
7665 }
7666 } else if (name == "types") {
7667 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7668 VTKElementType VTKType;
7669 switch (cell.getType()) {
7670
7671 case ElementType::VERTEX:
7672 VTKType = VTKElementType::VERTEX;
7673 break;
7674
7675 case ElementType::LINE:
7676 VTKType = VTKElementType::LINE;
7677 break;
7678
7679 case ElementType::TRIANGLE:
7680 VTKType = VTKElementType::TRIANGLE;
7681 break;
7682
7683 case ElementType::PIXEL:
7684 VTKType = VTKElementType::PIXEL;
7685 break;
7686
7687 case ElementType::QUAD:
7688 VTKType = VTKElementType::QUAD;
7689 break;
7690
7691 case ElementType::POLYGON:
7692 VTKType = VTKElementType::POLYGON;
7693 break;
7694
7695 case ElementType::TETRA:
7696 VTKType = VTKElementType::TETRA;
7697 break;
7698
7699 case ElementType::VOXEL:
7700 VTKType = VTKElementType::VOXEL;
7701 break;
7702
7703 case ElementType::HEXAHEDRON:
7704 VTKType = VTKElementType::HEXAHEDRON;
7705 break;
7706
7707 case ElementType::WEDGE:
7708 VTKType = VTKElementType::WEDGE;
7709 break;
7710
7711 case ElementType::PYRAMID:
7712 VTKType = VTKElementType::PYRAMID;
7713 break;
7714
7715 case ElementType::POLYHEDRON:
7716 VTKType = VTKElementType::POLYHEDRON;
7717 break;
7718
7719 default:
7720 VTKType = VTKElementType::UNDEFINED;
7721 break;
7722
7723 }
7724
7725 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, (int) VTKType);
7726 }
7727 } else if (name == "connectivity") {
7728 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7729 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell.getVertexIds();
7730 const int nCellVertices = cellVertexIds.size();
7731 for (int k = 0; k < nCellVertices; ++k) {
7732 long vertexId = cellVertexIds[k];
7733 long vtkVertexId = m_vtkVertexMap.at(vertexId);
7734 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, vtkVertexId);
7735 }
7736 }
7737 } else if (name == "faces") {
7738 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7739 if (cell.getDimension() <= 2 || cell.hasInfo()) {
7740 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, (long) 0);
7741 } else {
7742 std::vector<long> faceStream = cell.getFaceStream();
7743 Cell::renumberFaceStream(m_vtkVertexMap, &faceStream);
7744 int faceStreamSize = faceStream.size();
7745 for (int k = 0; k < faceStreamSize; ++k) {
7746 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, faceStream[k]);
7747 }
7748 }
7749 }
7750 } else if (name == "faceoffsets") {
7751 long offset = 0;
7752 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7753 if (cell.getDimension() <= 2 || cell.hasInfo()) {
7754 offset += 1;
7755 } else {
7756 offset += cell.getFaceStreamSize();
7757 }
7758
7759 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, offset);
7760 }
7761 } else if (name == "cellIndex") {
7762 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7763 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, cell.getId());
7764 }
7765 } else if (name == "PID") {
7766 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7767 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, cell.getPID());
7768 }
7769 } else if (name == "vertexIndex") {
7770 VertexConstIterator endItr = vertexConstEnd();
7771 for (VertexConstIterator itr = vertexConstBegin(); itr != endItr; ++itr) {
7772 std::size_t vertexRawId = itr.getRawIndex();
7773 long vertexVTKId = m_vtkVertexMap.rawAt(vertexRawId);
7774 if (vertexVTKId != Vertex::NULL_ID) {
7775 long vertexId = itr.getId();
7776 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, vertexId);
7777 }
7778 }
7779#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7780 } else if (name == "cellGlobalIndex") {
7781 PatchNumberingInfo numberingInfo(this);
7782 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7783 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, numberingInfo.getCellGlobalId(cell.getId()));
7784 }
7785 } else if (name == "cellRank") {
7786 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7787 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, getCellRank(cell.getId()));
7788 }
7789 } else if (name == "vertexRank") {
7790 VertexConstIterator endItr = vertexConstEnd();
7791 for (VertexConstIterator itr = vertexConstBegin(); itr != endItr; ++itr) {
7792 std::size_t vertexRawId = itr.getRawIndex();
7793 long vertexVTKId = m_vtkVertexMap.rawAt(vertexRawId);
7794 if (vertexVTKId != Vertex::NULL_ID) {
7795 genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, getVertexRank(itr.getId()));
7796 }
7797 }
7798#endif
7799 }
7800}
7801
7807void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumberVertices(long offset)
7808{
7809 // Renumber vertices
7810 std::unordered_map<long, long > map = consecutiveItemRenumbering(m_vertices, offset);
7811
7812 // Renumber cell connectivity
7813 for(Cell &cell : m_cells) {
7814 cell.renumberVertices(map);
7815 }
7816
7817 // Renumber interface connectivity
7818 for(Interface &interface : getInterfaces()) {
7819 interface.renumberVertices(map);
7820 }
7821}
7822
7828void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumberCells(long offset)
7829{
7830 // Renumber cells
7831 std::unordered_map<long, long > map = consecutiveItemRenumbering(m_cells, offset);
7832
7833 // Renumber cell adjacencies
7834 for (auto &cell: m_cells) {
7835 long *adjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies();
7836 int nCellAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount();
7837 for (int i = 0; i < nCellAdjacencies; ++i) {
7838 long &neighId = adjacencies[i];
7839 neighId = map[neighId];
7840 }
7841 }
7842
7843 // Renumber interface owner and neighbour
7844 for (Interface &interface: m_interfaces) {
7845 long ownerId = interface.getOwner();
7846 int ownerFace = interface.getOwnerFace();
7847 interface.setOwner(map.at(ownerId), ownerFace);
7848
7849 long neighId = interface.getNeigh();
7850 if (neighId >= 0) {
7851 int neighFace = interface.getNeighFace();
7852 interface.setNeigh(map.at(neighId), neighFace);
7853 }
7854 }
7855
7856 // Renumber last internal and first ghost markers
7857 if (m_lastInternalCellId >= 0) {
7858 m_lastInternalCellId = map.at(m_lastInternalCellId);
7859 }
7860
7861#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7862 if (m_firstGhostCellId >= 0) {
7863 m_firstGhostCellId = map.at(m_firstGhostCellId);
7864 }
7865#endif
7866
7867#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7868 // Update partitioning information
7869 if (isPartitioned()) {
7870 updatePartitioningInfo(true);
7871 }
7872#endif
7873}
7874
7880void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumberInterfaces(long offset)
7881{
7882 // Renumber interfaces
7883 std::unordered_map<long, long > map = consecutiveItemRenumbering(m_interfaces, offset);
7884
7885 // Renumber cell interfaces
7886 for (Cell &cell: m_cells) {
7887 long *interfaces = cell.getInterfaces();
7888 int nCellInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount();
7889 for (int i = 0; i < nCellInterfaces; ++i) {
7890 long &interfaceId = interfaces[i];
7891 interfaceId = map.at(interfaceId);
7892 }
7893 }
7894}
7895
7904void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumber(long vertexOffset, long cellOffset, long interfaceOffset)
7905{
7906 consecutiveRenumberVertices(vertexOffset);
7907 consecutiveRenumberCells(cellOffset);
7908 consecutiveRenumberInterfaces(interfaceOffset);
7909}

7916int PatchKernel::getDumpVersion() const

7919
7920 return (KERNEL_DUMP_VERSION + _getDumpVersion());
7921}

7932bool PatchKernel::dump(std::ostream &stream)
7933{
7934 // Update the patch
7935 update();
7936
7937 // Dump the patch
7938 const PatchKernel *constPatch = this;
7939 return constPatch->dump(stream);
7940}
7941
7953bool PatchKernel::dump(std::ostream &stream) const
7954{
7955 // Dumping a dirty patch is not supported.
7956 bool dirty = isDirty(true);
7957 assert(!dirty && "Dumping a patch that is not up-to-date is not supported.");
7958 if (dirty) {
7959 return false;
7960 }
7961
7962 // Version
7963 utils::binary::write(stream, getDumpVersion());
7964
7965 // Generic information
7966 utils::binary::write(stream, m_id);
7967 utils::binary::write(stream, m_dimension);
7968 utils::binary::write(stream, m_vtk.getName());
7969#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7970 utils::binary::write(stream, m_haloSize);
7971#else
7972 utils::binary::write(stream, 0);
7973#endif
7974
7975 // Spawn status
7976 utils::binary::write(stream, m_spawnStatus);
7977
7978 // Adaption status
7979 utils::binary::write(stream, m_adaptionStatus);
7980
7981 // Partition status
7982#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7983 utils::binary::write(stream, m_partitioningStatus);
7984#else
7985 utils::binary::write(stream, PARTITIONING_UNSUPPORTED);
7986#endif
7987
7988 // Adjacencies build strategy
7989 utils::binary::write(stream, m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy);
7990
7991 // Dump interfaces build strategy
7992 utils::binary::write(stream, m_interfacesBuildStrategy);
7993
7994 // VTK data
7995 utils::binary::write(stream, m_vtkWriteTarget);
7996
7997 // Specific dump
7998 _dump(stream);
7999
8000 // Geometric tolerance
8001 utils::binary::write(stream, (int) m_toleranceCustom);
8002 if (m_toleranceCustom) {
8003 utils::binary::write(stream, m_tolerance);
8004 }
8005
8006 // Index generators
8007 bool hasVertexAutoIndexing = isVertexAutoIndexingEnabled();
8008 utils::binary::write(stream, hasVertexAutoIndexing);
8009 if (hasVertexAutoIndexing) {
8010 dumpVertexAutoIndexing(stream);
8011 }
8012
8013 bool hasInterfaceAutoIndexing = isInterfaceAutoIndexingEnabled();
8014 utils::binary::write(stream, hasInterfaceAutoIndexing);
8015 if (hasInterfaceAutoIndexing) {
8016 dumpInterfaceAutoIndexing(stream);
8017 }
8018
8019 bool hasCellAutoIndexing = isCellAutoIndexingEnabled();
8020 utils::binary::write(stream, hasCellAutoIndexing);
8021 if (hasCellAutoIndexing) {
8022 dumpCellAutoIndexing(stream);
8023 }
8024
8025 // The patch has been dumped successfully
8026 return true;
8027}
8028
8036void PatchKernel::restore(std::istream &stream, bool reregister)
8037{
8038 // Reset the patch
8039 reset();
8040
8041 // Version
8042 int version;
8043 utils::binary::read(stream, version);
8044 if (version != getDumpVersion()) {
8045 throw std::runtime_error ("The version of the file does not match the required version");
8046 }
8047
8048 // Id
8049 int id;
8050 utils::binary::read(stream, id);
8051 if (reregister) {
8052 setId(id);
8053 }
8054
8055 // Dimension
8056 int dimension;
8057 utils::binary::read(stream, dimension);
8058 setDimension(dimension);
8059
8060 // Name
8061 std::string name;
8062 utils::binary::read(stream, name);
8063 m_vtk.setName(name);
8064
8065 // Halo size
8066#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8067 utils::binary::read(stream, m_haloSize);
8068#else
8069 int dummyHaloSize;
8070 utils::binary::read(stream, dummyHaloSize);
8071#endif
8072
8073 // Spawn status
8074 utils::binary::read(stream, m_spawnStatus);
8075
8076 // Adaption status
8077 utils::binary::read(stream, m_adaptionStatus);
8078
8079 // Partition status
8080#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8081 utils::binary::read(stream, m_partitioningStatus);
8082#else
8083 PartitioningStatus dummyPartitioningStatus;
8084 utils::binary::read(stream, dummyPartitioningStatus);
8085#endif
8086
8087 // Adjacencies build strategy
8088 utils::binary::read(stream, m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy);
8089
8090 // Interfaces build strategy
8091 utils::binary::read(stream, m_interfacesBuildStrategy);
8092
8093 // VTK data
8094 utils::binary::read(stream, m_vtkWriteTarget);
8095
8096 // Specific restore
8097 _restore(stream);
8098
8099#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8100 // Update partitioning information
8101 if (isPartitioned()) {
8102 updatePartitioningInfo(true);
8103 }
8104#endif
8105
8106 // Geometric tolerance
8107 int hasCustomTolerance;
8108 utils::binary::read(stream, hasCustomTolerance);
8109 if (hasCustomTolerance) {
8110 double tolerance;
8111 utils::binary::read(stream, tolerance);
8112 setTol(tolerance);
8113 } else {
8114 resetTol();
8115 }
8116
8117 // Index generators
8118 bool hasVertexAutoIndexing;
8119 utils::binary::read(stream, hasVertexAutoIndexing);
8120 if (hasVertexAutoIndexing) {
8121 restoreVertexAutoIndexing(stream);
8122 } else {
8123 setVertexAutoIndexing(false);
8124 }
8125
8126 bool hasInterfaceAutoIndexing;
8127 utils::binary::read(stream, hasInterfaceAutoIndexing);
8128 if (hasInterfaceAutoIndexing) {
8129 restoreInterfaceAutoIndexing(stream);
8130 } else {
8131 setInterfaceAutoIndexing(false);
8132 }
8133
8134 bool hasCellAutoIndexing;
8135 utils::binary::read(stream, hasCellAutoIndexing);
8136 if (hasCellAutoIndexing) {
8137 restoreCellAutoIndexing(stream);
8138 } else {
8139 setCellAutoIndexing(false);
8140 }
8141}
8142
8149void PatchKernel::mergeAdaptionInfo(std::vector<adaption::Info> &&source, std::vector<adaption::Info> &destination)
8150{
8151 if (source.empty()) {
8152 return;
8153 } else if (destination.empty()) {
8154 destination.swap(source);
8155 return;
8156 }
8157
8158 throw std::runtime_error ("Unable to merge the adaption info.");
8159}
